summary: TypeScript SDK client crashes silently when directly awaiting promises from methods like `client.workflow.start()`. The issue occurs due to a gRPC-js dependency version problem that causes the Node.js process to exit prematurely when async operations complete.
userImpact: Users cannot directly await client operations without experiencing silent process crashes, severely impacting usability of the SDK in standard async workflows.
rootCause: Incompatible @grpc/grpc-js versions (1.8.0-1.8.6) causing the Node.js process to exit prematurely when awaiting promises returned from Client methods
proposedFix: Update @grpc/grpc-js dependency to version 1.8.7 or later, which fixes the underlying gRPC-js issue
workaround: Avoid directly awaiting client promises; use Promise.all() with a delay, or add a ref to keep the event loop alive (e.g., setInterval with large timeout)
resolutionDetails: Fixed in SDK version 1.8.7 by updating @grpc/grpc-js dependency. Issue was related to grpc-node#2318.
keyQuote: Seems to be fixed properly in 1.8.7 now. Closing as there is nothing more to be done on this ticket.
